data.title: Mercer University Athletics
data.meta_description: Having already gained a plethora of experience while undergoing the rigors of being a successful NCAA Division I student-athlete, Donovan Schultz begins his first
data.text:
Choose a Staff Member:

Donovan Schultz

Title

Graduate Assistant

(MSOC, MGOLF, BASE, BVB)

Alma Mater

Evansville, 2024

Office Phone

(478) 301-5209

Email

donovan.schultz@live.mercer.edu

Having already gained a plethora of experience while undergoing the rigors of being a successful NCAA Division I student-athlete, Donovan Schultz begins his first year at Mercer in 2024-25 as a graduate assistant in the athletic media relations department. He is charged with the day-to-day athletic communications responsibilities for the men’s soccer, men’s golf and baseball teams. He also serves as the secondary media contact for Mercer’s nationally-prominent men’s basketball program.

Schultz has already gained invaluable experience in athletic administration as a part of a handful of internships and practicums he took on while an undergraduate at Evansville. He put his foot in the door as a crew member with UE’s ESPN+ production efforts, and later served as a video production intern with the Northwoods League’s Mankato Moondogs during the club’s 2023 campaign. He also successfully completed a stint with Evansville’s athletics department where he immersed himself in a practicum to create social media content for the baseball program.

An eight-term member of the Missouri Valley Conference Honor Roll and two-time first team academic all-conference honoree, Schultz picked up the MVC’s Elite 17 Award for the second-straight season in 2024 as well. An integral part the Evansville pitching staff, Schultz logged 57 appearances (50 starts) for the Aces from 2021-24 and struck out 206 batters in 248-1/3 career innings pitched, including a career-best 90-2/3 innings pitched as a senior amid UE’s run to the school’s first appearance in NCAA Super Regionals.

Schultz earned his bachelor’s degree in sports communication from Evansville in 2024 after maintaining a 3.96 cumulative grade point average at the distinguished institution. He is currently pursuing his master’s degree in organizational leadership at Mercer.
